remarks: Initial objects are essentially unique, if A is an initial object, then so is every object that is isomorphic to A. Proposition 7.3 (2) in [Adamek] p. 102.  (Contributed by AV, 10-Apr-2020.)
statement:
initoeu1.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
initoeu1.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( InitO ` C ) ) $.
initoeu2.i $e |- ( ph -> A ( ~=c ` C ) B ) $.
initoeu2 $p |- ( ph -> B e. ( InitO ` C ) ) $.
